intro: Meiogyne philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine meiogyne, is a species of flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in lowland and montane forests, often in shaded environments. It produces small, fleshy berries that are dispersed by birds, contributing to its ecological role in the region. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
